iti88:1.1: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
iti88:2.1: “Mendicants, there are these three inner stains, inner foes, inner enemies, inner killers, and inner adversaries.
iti88:2.6: These three are inner stains, inner foes, inner enemies, inner killers, and inner adversaries.”
iti88:2.7: That is what the Buddha said.
iti88:4.1: A greedy person doesn’t know the good.
iti88:4.2: A greedy person doesn’t see the truth.
iti88:4.3: When a person is beset by greed,
iti88:5.1: Those who have given up greed,
iti88:5.2: are not greedy even when provoked.
iti88:5.3: When greed is given up, it rolls off
iti88:5.4: like a drop from a lotus-leaf.
